Sentence.sentText: Question: Working at a psychiatric hospital, we often come across the diagnosis of “complicated bereavement.”
What is the correct code for “complicated bereavement” when there is no mention of adjustment reaction/disorder? What code is assigned, if the death was not of a family member?
Answer: Assign code F43.21, Adjustment disorder with depressed mood, for “complicated bereavement.”
Complicated bereavement/grief is described as a grief reaction.
The fact that the death was not of a family member does not affect this code assignment.
Disappearance and death of family member, is assigned when the diagnostic statement lists only “Bereavement” and it involves a family member.
